meanings.definition: A person who shares the duties of anchoring a television or radio program with another person.
meanings.sent1: The coanchor reported the news alongside their colleague.
meanings.sent2: The coanchor and the main anchor worked together to deliver the weather forecast.
meanings.sent3: The coanchor accidentally spilled coffee on their script during the live broadcast.
meanings.sent4: Being a coanchor is like being a team captain in a newsroom.
meanings.sent5: The coanchor's friendly smile brightened up the studio every morning.

meanings.definition: To serve as a coanchor on a television or radio program.
meanings.sent1: She will coanchor the evening news program starting next week.
meanings.sent2: They coanchor the morning show with great chemistry and professionalism.
meanings.sent3: He decided to coanchor the cooking segment even though he couldn't boil water.
meanings.sent4: Coanchoring requires good communication and teamwork skills.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to coanchor the prime time slot was a dream come true for her.
